isis.stitle: TSI 02-12-06 - Vocational Lower Water Inlet Tube Available

subjectgroup.subject: Vocational Lower Water Inlet Tube Available

geninfo.para: Vehicles involved in snow plowing operations where the engine is operating under full load may experience lower radiator hose contact with the front engine crossmember. A new lower water inlet tube is available that increases I-6 water inlet to engine front crossmember clearance an additional 0.4 inch.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury from hot coolant and steam, always allow an engine to cool before performing cooling system repairs. Once the engine has cooled, slowly loosen the pressure cap, then pause for a moment to allow any residual pressure to escape. Continue to unscrew cap and remove only after pressure in cooling system is fully released.

step1.para: Drain coolant from radiator and engine.
Remove all hoses from the engine water inlet.
Clean the mounting surface on the engine.
Move makeup line fittings from old water inlet to new water inlet duplicating fitting orientation and sealing pipe tapers with Teflon tape as required.
Install new gasket and new water inlet on the engine and torque bolts to 18 ft-lbs.
Install hoses on the new engine water inlet.
Refill to proper fill level with correct coolant.
Start and operate engine until it reaches normal operating temperature.
Observe coolant reservoir for proper coolant level and adjust as needed.
